Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Diazoxide Cardioprotection in Mouse Models of Global Ischemia

Trial_Design.evidence: Sample size calculations were based on detecting a 5% ± 4% difference with 80% power.

Intervention.evidence: Myocytes were exposed to Tyrode's solution, hyperkalemic cardioplegia (CPG) ± diazoxide, ± VU591 (Kir1.1 inhibitor), and Tyrode's solution again.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to elucidate its mechanism of action to develop targeted therapies for cardiac surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was measured over a 20-minute period for myocytes and a 90-minute ischemia with 30-minute reperfusion for hearts.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Investigators were blinded to group assignments.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Myocyte contractility was reduced by CPG but preserved by diazoxide. VU591 negated diazoxide's effect in myocytes. In hearts, diazoxide improved left ventricular function post-ischemia in all mouse types.
